creator.name: Raad der Amerikaanse Koloniën en Bezittingen/ Raad der Koloniën
creator.name_english: Council for the American Colonies and Possessions / Council for the Colonies
creator.his_func: In 1792 the Council for the American Colonies and Possessions, or Council for the Colonies for short, was established. It had a central direction consisting of 11 persons, delegated by the respective provinces. The Stadtholder, holding the title of Governor-General of the colonies, would always be admitted to the meetings and had a decisive vote. The Council governed the West Indian affairs in the name of the States General, which maintained the supervision. In the cities where formerly the Chambers of the West India Company (WIC) had resided, Commissioners for the West Indian Commerce were established. These could not operate independently, however, but were subordinate to the general administration.
